item.title: Will add a quote by Isaac Asimov
item.description: "Intelligence is an accident of evolution, and not necessarily an advantage." -- Isaac Asimov

item.title: Will add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "With freedom, books, flowers, and the moon, who could not be happy?" -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Will add a quote by Ambrose Bierce
item.description: "The covers of this book are too far apart." -- Ambrose Bierce

item.title: Will add a quote by Ambrose Bierce
item.description: "Speak when you are angry and you will make the best speech you will ever regret." -- Ambrose Bierce

item.title: Will add a quote by Ambrose Bierce
item.description: "In our civilization, and under our republican form of government, intelligence is so highly honored that it is rewarded by exemption from the cares of office." -- Ambrose Bierce

item.title: Will add a quote by Ambrose Bierce
item.description: "Selfish, adj. Devoid of consideration for the selfishness of others." -- Ambrose Bierce

item.title: Will add a quote by Ambrose Bierce
item.description: "All are lunatics, but he who can analyze his delusion is called a philosopher." -- Ambrose Bierce

item.title: Will add a quote by Ambrose Bierce
item.description: "Hash, x. There is no definition for this word - nobody knows what hash is. Famous, adj. Conspicuously miserable. Dictionary, n. A malevolent literary device for cramping the growth of a language and making it hard and inelastic. This dictionary, however, is a most useful work." -- Ambrose Bierce

item.title: Will add a quote by Ambrose Bierce
item.description: "<b>Redemption, n.</b> Deliverance of sinners from the penalty of their sin through their murder of the deity against whom they sinned. The doctrine of Redemption is the fundamental mystery of our holy religions, and whoso believeth in it shall not perish, but have everlasting life in which to try to understand it." -- Ambrose Bierce

item.title: Will add a quote by Marvin Simkin
item.description: "Democracy is not freedom. Democracy is two wolves and a lamb voting on what to eat for lunch. Freedom comes from the recognition of certain rights which may not be taken, not even by a 99% vote." -- Marvin Simkin

item.title: Will add a quote by Ambrose Bierce
item.description: "Mayonnaise: One of the sauces which serve the French in place of a state religion." -- Ambrose Bierce

item.title: Will add a quote by Ambrose Bierce
item.description: "Corporation, n. An ingenious device for obtaining individual profit without individual responsibility." -- Ambrose Bierce

item.title: Will add a quote by Ambrose Bierce
item.description: "Education, n. That which discloses to the wise and disguises from the foolish their lack of understanding." -- Ambrose Bierce

item.title: Will add a quote by Ambrose Bierce
item.description: "HOMICIDE, n. The slaying of one human being by another. There are four kinds of homicide: felonious, excusable, justifiable, and praiseworthy, but it makes no great difference to the person slain whether he fell by one kind or another -- the classification is for advantage of the lawyers." -- Ambrose Bierce

item.title: Will add a quote by Ambrose Bierce
item.description: "Quotation, n: The act of repeating erroneously the words of another." -- Ambrose Bierce

item.title: Will add a quote by Ambrose Bierce
item.description: "<b>Ocean</b>, n. A body of water occupying about two-thirds of a world made for man — who has no gills." -- Ambrose Bierce

item.title: Will add a quote by Ambrose Bierce
item.description: "Conservative, n: A statesman who is enamored of existing evils, as distinguished from the Liberal who wishes to replace them with others." -- Ambrose Bierce

item.title: Will add a quote by Ambrose Bierce
item.description: "Bore, n.: A person who talks when you wish him to listen." -- Ambrose Bierce

item.title: Will add a quote by Ambrose Bierce
item.description: "Cogito cogito ergo cogito sum -- "I think that I think, therefore I think that I am;" as close an approach to certainty as any philosopher has yet made." -- Ambrose Bierce

item.title: Will add a quote by Ambrose Bierce
item.description: "Dawn: When men of reason go to bed." -- Ambrose Bierce

item.title: Will add a quote by Ambrose Bierce
item.description: "FIDELITY, n. A virtue peculiar to those who are about to be betrayed." -- Ambrose Bierce

item.title: Will add a quote by Ambrose Bierce
item.description: "<b>Egotist</b>, n. A person of low taste, more interested in himself than in me." -- Ambrose Bierce

item.title: Will add a quote by Ambrose Bierce
item.description: "Brain: an apparatus with which we think we think." -- Ambrose Bierce

item.title: Will add a quote by Ambrose Bierce
item.description: "<b>Positive</b>, adj.: Mistaken at the top of one's voice." -- Ambrose Bierce

item.title: Will add a quote by Ambrose Bierce
item.description: "Admiration, n.: Our polite recognition of another's resemblance to ourselves." -- Ambrose Bierce

item.title: Will add a quote by Ambrose Bierce
item.description: "Lawyer – One skilled in the circumvention of the law." -- Ambrose Bierce

item.title: Will add a quote by Ambrose Bierce
item.description: "Philosophy - A route of many roads leading from nowhere to nothing." -- Ambrose Bierce

item.title: Will add a quote by Ambrose Bierce
item.description: "VOTE, n. The instrument and symbol of a freeman's power to make a fool of himself and a wreck of his country." -- Ambrose Bierce

item.title: Will add a quote by Ambrose Bierce
item.description: "Christian - One who follows the teachings of Christ insofar as they are not inconsistent with a life of sin." -- Ambrose Bierce

item.title: Will add a quote by Ambrose Bierce
item.description: "Impiety, n. Your irreverence toward my deity." -- Ambrose Bierce
